title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 September 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:17 <coud> has quit  
00:32 <CIA-122> has quit  
02:08 <jvelo> has quit  
04:13 <Denis> has quit  
05:01 <eshan> has joined #xwiki  
05:05 <eshan> has left #xwiki  
07:01 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:02 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
07:13 <jvelo> has quit  
07:27 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:47 <mflorea> has quit  
07:55 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:07 <vmassol> has quit  
08:21 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
08:23 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:23 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <mflorea> has quit  
08:47 <mflorea1> has quit  
09:19 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <+Denis> vmassol: why object definition and not class ?  
09:33 <vmassol> Denis: I was sure someone was going to ask this… ;) I need to dig the email thread about this  
09:33 <vmassol> I don't remember if we already voted/discussed this one or if it was just between thomas and me  
09:34 <+Denis> I do not either  
09:34 <+Denis> just found it long and not necessarily better  
09:34 <+Denis> curious to have the justifications  
09:35 <vmassol> it's easier to understand IMO that it's an object definition  
09:35 <+Denis> but there is already a large usage of XClass  
09:36 <vmassol> from sergiu:  
09:36 <vmassol> +1, but as Vincent said, we must revisit these names. We've agreed for a  
09:36 <vmassol> long time that Class is not a good name. This should be a distinct vote.  
09:36 <vmassol> http://xwiki.markmail.org/search/?q=ObjectDefinition#query:ObjectDefinition  
09:36 <vmassol> I haven't found a strong consensus vote in the archive  
09:37 <vmassol> but you can read what's been sent so far  
09:37 <vmassol> there are several threads abfout this  
09:37 <vmassol> (found at least 2)à  
09:37 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <vmassol> this one for ex: http://xwiki.markmail.org/thread/7yrztvmo3tivagdo  
09:38 <vmassol> http://xwiki.markmail.org/thread/o7s2na27wkbdg5ao  
09:38 <vmassol> http://xwiki.markmail.org/thread/o7s2na27wkbdg5ao  
09:38 <vmassol> that's the same ;)  
09:38 <vmassol> http://xwiki.markmail.org/thread/3fucvk67gwuk7wcj  
09:38 <vmassol> etc  
09:40 <vmassol> I have no issue resending another vote for Object Definition  
09:40 <+Denis> yep, but it is somewhat related to the current vote, since Class and XClass is not the same IMO  
09:40 <vmassol> let's finish this one first though  
09:40 <vmassol> but yes if you change to Class it makes it worse for some proposal in the currnet vote  
09:41 <vmassol> s / worse / even worse  
09:41 <vmassol> but I don't think it changes anything  
09:41 <+Denis> what I dislike in ObjectDefinition, is that its a 2 word while others are single  
09:41 <vmassol> since there's already Object  
09:41 <vmassol> sure but tell me in english  
09:41 <vmassol> how you name it  
09:41 <vmassol> you'll use two wors  
09:41 <vmassol> words  
09:41 <vmassol> you can't make it shorter  
09:41 <vmassol> but that's what it is  
09:41 <sdumitriu> Datatype? Type?  
09:41 <vmassol> type of what?  
09:41 <vmassol> data type of what?  
09:42 <sdumitriu> Or maybe just Definition  
09:42 <vmassol> that's too generic  
09:42 <vmassol> definition of what?  
09:42 <vmassol> of a document?  
09:42 <vmassol> of a wiki?  
09:42 <vmassol> of a page?  
09:42 <vmassol> it's again too generic  
09:42 <vmassol> no you need to have a non generic name  
09:42 <sdumitriu> Well, everything is generic  
09:42 <vmassol> and then you need documentztion  
09:42 <vmassol> while OD speaks by itself  
09:42 <+Denis> while XClass is not so bad at the end, if used consistently, and in that case favor 4) in your proposal  
09:42 <vmassol> anyway  
09:43 <sdumitriu> You're just used to associating "Object" with XWiki objects, "Document" with an XWiki document, and so on  
09:43 <sdumitriu> Property? Property of a what?  
09:43 <sdumitriu> Document? Is that a word document?  
09:43 <sdumitriu> "Object" is a really abstract term  
09:44 <sdumitriu> It's hard for non-techies and newcomers to understand what "Object" means  
09:44 <vmassol> sdumitriu: yep, that's why there's propsal 5) if we want to pick another name for Object  
09:44 <vmassol> MetaData  
09:44 <sdumitriu> So no, I don't agree that ObjectDefinition is much clearer and needs less documentation  
09:44 <sdumitriu> It's a term  
09:44 <+Denis> +1  
09:44 <sdumitriu> We could call it a "zblarg"  
09:44 <vmassol> sdumitriu: make a proposal in answer ot the mail  
09:45 <vmassol> there's no point in sayinf it's not nice  
09:45 <vmassol> you need to propose sometihng  
09:45 <sdumitriu> I know  
09:45 <vmassol> we won't find someting 100% perfect  
09:45 <vmassol> we just need the best we can imagine  
09:45 <+Denis> We know, my initial question was, why not XClass ?  
09:45 <sdumitriu> I'm not saying it's not nice, I'm countering your claim that Type is too generic  
09:45 <vmassol> there's   huge difference  
09:45 <vmassol> between Type and Document  
09:45 <vmassol> one is more generic than the other  
09:46 <vmassol> and Stuff vs Type is also the same kind of differnce  
09:46 <vmassol> you can't put everything in the same baf  
09:46 <vmassol> bag  
09:46 <vmassol> if you're just seeing the world wirth 0 and 1 you're never going to be able to make differences between any proposal  
09:46 <vmassol> they'll all fail  
09:47 <+Denis> agreed, on the other hand, OOP is well know, and using their term could IMO make these terms less generic  
09:47 <vmassol> that's a valid point  
09:47 <vmassol> it's well know by devs  
09:47 <vmassol> though  
09:47 <vmassol> not by users  
09:47 <vmassol> so if they don't need to see those names it's ok  
09:47 <+Denis> but user does not do devs, and this is devs concerned here, no ?  
09:47 <vmassol> except that it's so well know  
09:47 <vmassol> that it clashes with the execution environment  
09:47 <vmassol> ;)  
09:48 <vmassol> Denis: it does  
09:48 <+Denis> this is why I say it is related to the current vote, and could favor 4)  
09:48 <sdumitriu> I'm just saying that when explaining XWiki to other people, I always call them "structured data type definition", I try to stay away from "object" and "class"  
09:48 <vmassol> because we want our users to be able to code apps  
09:48 <vmassol> in proposla 4 I hate XWiki for the wiki  
09:48 <vmassol> ;)  
09:49 <+Denis> again, user that will do some coding, would obviously need some programming background, and OOP is widely known  
09:49 <vmassol> it's so misleading  
09:49 <vmassol> Denis: I don't agree  
09:49 <+Denis> I agree  
09:49 <vmassol> weneed  our dev model to be simple  
09:49 <sdumitriu> I agree with Vincent here, Object and Class have strong associations for devs  
09:49 <vmassol> and I don't agree that we reuiqre that they follow an OOP course  
09:49 <vmassol> to be able to code in xwiki  
09:49 <vmassol> :)  
09:49 <sdumitriu> I've seen people asking about compiling the XClasses  
09:50 <+Denis> I do not say that, but there is chance they have already seen that  
09:50 <vmassol> all valid points Denis, I'm just playing devil's adovate  
09:50 <vmassol> advoxate  
09:50 <vmassol> advocate  
09:50 <+Denis> sure  
09:51 <vmassol> for me if we agree to change the name for Objects, something like Metadata is not that bad since in the new model we can add metadata to almost all entities  
09:51 <sdumitriu> And trying to use java function calls to access the object properties, thinking that since that's a class, XWiki generates a real Java class, with getters and setters  
09:51 <+Denis> as I said, since we will surely combine these word with other, I would really prefere single words, so, the structure will be preserved, and this could favor 2)  
09:51 <sdumitriu> So it is misleading  
09:51 <vmassol> the real quesiton for me is whether we want to stray away from what we have now  
09:52 <vmassol> since we've been spending years educating people about Objects  
09:52 <vmassol> (xwiki objects that is)  
09:53 <vmassol> I have the feeling we'll have a hard time reaching consensus on this one ;)  
09:53 <+Denis> :)  
09:54 <sdumitriu> We should have done this for XWiki 1.0  
09:54 <vmassol> yep  
09:55 <cjd> has quit  
09:59 <+Denis> vmassol: does the document entity replace XWikiDocument ? (just want to be sure where the difference is)  
09:59 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <vmassol> Denis: yes  
10:00 <vmassol> but without all methods not related to the model  
10:00 <+Denis> sue  
10:00 <+Denis> sure  
10:22 <+Denis> vmassol: do you really expect to mixup ObjectDefinition and ClassReference ?  
10:24 <jvdrean> has quit  
10:24 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <coud> Hi. I'm having trouble to get numbered list from XDOM. I created simple test based on numbered list created in WISIWYG editor. Test: http://hpaste.org/74729 and output: http://hpaste.org/74730 . I expected NumberedListBlock to appear in the output but the items of the numbered list seem to be unstructered text only.  
10:27 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <coud> Do I have to use some another functions to get list items from XDOM ?  
10:28 <sdumitriu> coud: You should probably add some \n in there  
10:30 <coud> sdumitriu thanks, with newlines it works  
10:32 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <coud> I got the input throught REST api and copied it from browser, it seems that newlines got lost somewhere  
10:57 <+sburjan> does anybody have an idea how to only get the issues in jira which have attachments ?  
11:00 <vmassol> sburjan: I don't think it's possible. What's your need?  
11:00 <vmassol> (with JQL I mean)  
11:01 <+sburjan> I need to perform some tests with Open Office and Libre Office. And I was thinking the jira to be a good resource of documents to use them tot test  
11:02 <vmassol> with a SQL query it should be possible though: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACOM/Example+SQL+queries+for+JIRA  
11:02 <vmassol> i don't understand  
11:02 <vmassol> if all you need is images or documents  
11:02 <vmassol> there are way better sites on the wbe  
11:02 <vmassol> web  
11:03 <vmassol> https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-3570  
11:03 <+sburjan> yes, but I was thinking that in jira we haso have "bad" word files, which crashed import on the users who attached them  
11:03 <vmassol> just search for office component  
11:03 <vmassol> and you'll find them  
11:03 <vmassol> manually  
11:04 <coud> JQL tricks plugin has "hasAttachments" function https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.j-tricks%3Ajql-plugin  
11:04 <vmassol> https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JTOOL/JIRA+Toolkit+Plugin has an attachment count info too  
11:05 <vmassol> but all of those are too complicated for sburjan's need  
11:05 <vmassol> which is a one shot thing  
11:05 <vmassol> manual should do fine for this  
11:05 <+sburjan> ok. thanks. I'll get some manually  
11:05 <vmassol> sburjan: getting random docs on the web is a much better strategy to get all sorts of documents to import  
11:06 <vmassol> you won't know if the result is ok but you can test that the process doesn't fail  
11:06 <+sburjan> yes, I'll have to search for a bundle. maybe somone made some packages exactly for testing purposes  
11:06 <vmassol> to test if the import works you need to know the expected result  
11:06 <+sburjan> yes, I agree  
11:07 <vmassol> sburjan: http://www.scribd.com/ will provides thousands of docs  
11:08 <vmassol> they even have an api apparently: http://www.scribd.com/developers  
11:08 <vmassol> http://www.scribd.com/developers/platform  
11:08 <vmassol> (that's if you wish to automate, not sure you need that right now although it would be cool)  
11:08 <+sburjan> I need doc, docx, ppty formats  
11:08 <vmassol> a {{scrib}} macro could be fun too btw ;)  
11:08 <vmassol> sburjan: you'll get all those on scribd I believe  
11:09 <+sburjan> yes, a macro like that would be col to embed :D  
11:09 <vmassol> https://github.com/mikwat/jscribd  
11:11 <vmassol> for PPT for ex: http://www.scribd.com/search?category=&language=&num\_pages=&filetype=ppt&uploaded\_on=&paid=false&query=test  
11:11 <vmassol> (I searched for "test")  
11:12 <vmassol> (and free and type = ppt)  
11:13 <+sburjan> thanks vmassol ! They even have text mixed with images, so this is even better  
11:25 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki

15:38 <+jvdrean> mflorea: shouldn't we disable the distribution wizard for -SNAPSHOT versions ?  
15:38 <+jvdrean> it doesn't find any available package and it makes the startup quite longer  
15:38 <+mflorea> jvdrean: why?  
15:39 <+mflorea> you can simply skip the wizard or register the snapshots maven repo  
15:40 <+mflorea> and if it makes the startup time longer then this needs to be fixed because it affects stable versions too  
15:40 <ries> has quit  
15:40 <+mflorea> although I didn't notice this  
15:41 <+jvdrean> mflorea: may be it's just an impression then :)  
15:42 <phancox> has quit  
16:01 <kwoot> has joined #xwiki  
16:03 <kwoot> Hi all. The http://www.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/Offer/Support page still does not work in IE on winXP terminal server, but nog even on FF or Chrome, both on Linux. How to find financiel info about the Xwiki product?  
16:04 <+sburjan> kwoot: try clearing your cache, because it works for me  
16:04 <kwoot> Ah, that is a good one. F5 works or need I do more?  
16:05 <vmassol> shift+F5 I think  
16:05 <vmassol> or ctrl+F5  
16:05 <vmassol> (don't remember been 7 years since I last used IE on winXP ;))  
16:05 <+sburjan> F5 is just a simple refresh, it does not force a flush cache  
16:05 <+sburjan> ctrl+F5 :)  
16:07 <kwoot> Hm, still no joy. But it's good that I am the only one suffering and not the rest of the planet :-)  
16:09 <+sburjan> kwoot: what is more xactly the problem ? the tabs don't load ?  
16:10 <+sburjan> afaik I remember you reported this once in the past, and I think you solved it by clearing your cache. ctrl+F5 or  ctrl+r did the trick  
16:11 <+sburjan> cand you check if ctrl+r fixes the issue ?  
16:11 <kwoot> The tabs are shown, but all the tabs of this page show the same info, "What technical support includes". I looked at this before but did not find a solution. I have no clue what it is. Let me try the javascript console...  
16:15 <kwoot> Hm, no real error messages. Strange behaviour.  
16:19 <silviar> Hi! It's very strange. I am not experiencing the issue either. What you could do is send an email to [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) and ask for the information you need. I am sure somebody from the XWiki team will be happy to reply to your email with all the details.  
16:19 <+sburjan> kwoot: could you try using another machine or without terminal services ?  
16:23 <kwoot> sburjan: will do soon. Other work to do and just thought, let's check again.  
16:46 <kwoot> has left #xwiki  
17:29 <+jvdrean> vmassol: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WikiComponent+Module  
17:30 <+jvdrean> did you had a working example for "Write components entirely in documents" in the end ?  
17:36 <silviar> has quit  
17:39 <vmassol> jvdrean: cool  
17:39 <vmassol> I tested with a macro  
17:39 <vmassol> and a listener (which didn't work)  
17:39 <vmassol> I haven't tested more yet  
17:39 <vmassol> I need to find some use cases….  
17:42 <+jvdrean> vmassol: what was failing exactly with the listener ?  
17:43 <vmassol> 2 things AFAIR: 1) the reregistering (not a big deal but  a warning) and 2) it wasn't called for some reason  
17:43 <vmassol> but I didn't get the time to invesdtigate

23:43 <vmassol> going to bed, if someone feels like answering a xwiki question on stackoverflow, or direct him to our mailing list: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12430953/how-to-extend-a-class-thats-not-in-my-project  
23:43 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Already answered  
23:43 <vmassol> ok :)  
23:43 <sdumitriu> (by someone else)  
23:43 <vmassol> didn't see it  
23:43 <sdumitriu> Although I don't like the solution  
23:43 <sdumitriu> It's a hack  
23:43 <vmassol> ah someone else  
23:44 <sdumitriu> People should use Maven properly, and read our documentation  
23:44 <vmassol> maybe you should answer that? :)  
23:44 <sdumitriu> Maybe we should add a basic pom for writing a custom authenticator  
23:44 <vmassol> or better  
23:45 <vmassol> a maven archetype  
23:45 <sdumitriu> Although I think the existing contrib authenticators have a proper project setup  
23:48 <vmassol> nn  
23:49 <vmassol> before going slf4J 1.7.1 released FWIW :http://www.slf4j.org/news.html

23:49 <vmassol> nope
